lines.text: [as Henri and Margot walk down the aisle after being married]
Your mother hates me.
Yours hated me.
Yours *killed* mine.
One who gives life is no longer a mother once she takes that life back.
La Mole would die for us!
For *us*?
Yes, for us.
He'd die for another night with you.
Welcome to the family Henri; it's a bit peculiar but not that bad.
You come for the wedding?
No. That Margot is an evil whore. The wedding shames us all.
maybe she's ugly under her mask. Or disfigured. But it didn't matter. You wouldn't let me kiss you.
[they kiss]
I thought, she's even lonelier than me. She loves as though she is seeking revenge.
Promise me something. They say death always took your lovers. They say you lock their hearts in gold boxes around your bed.
They do? What else? That at night, wearing a mask, I roam the city, looking for love?
One day you'll know who you really are. Promise you won't forget me... the one you shouldn't have loved.
I promise.

[to Henri de Navarre]
The Protestants believe you betrayed them. They can't understand. What is betrayal but one's skill in following the flow of events?
I love my three children. I mean, all four of them.
Henri de Bourbon, do you take Marguerite de Valois as your wife?
I do.
Marguerite de Valois, do you take Henri de Bourbon, King of Navarre, as your husband?
[there is a pause]
Marguerite de Valois, do you take... In the name of God, and His Holy Church, I join you in matrimony.
